FLAX & HEMP
FIBER SOLUTIONS
hero.desc: Highly specialized engineering lines that convert raw bales from the field into cleaned, standardized industrial-grade fiber.

corporate.headline: We focus only on this field. And we are the best at it.
corporate.p1: RNG Export is an engineering and trading company fully dedicated to the pre-processing, fiber preparation and cottonization of flax and hemp fibers.
corporate.p2: We do not treat flax and hemp fiber technologies as a side business in this geography. We are fully focused on this single domain.
corporate.p3: RNG Export provides high-performance machinery lines, advanced engineering support and long-term process consultancy to globally investing companies.
corporate.mission_body: To deliver fiber processing lines that are highly efficient, energy-conscious, maintenance-friendly, compliant with ATEX/Ex-Proof safety standards, modular and scalable – and to bring each investment safely into operation.
corporate.vision_body: To become one of the most trusted brands worldwide in primary fiber preparation technologies for strategic raw materials such as flax and hemp.

vision_details.title: Industrial fiber production
vision_details.description: Production of industrial-grade fibers from natural fiber sources such as flax and hemp. Through RNG Export's advanced processing technologies, various industrial products are produced in formats such as cottonized fiber, long fiber, and short fiber, starting from raw bales. These fibers are used as critical raw materials in textile, composite, nonwoven, and biocomposite sectors.

vision_details.title: Cellulose production (alpha-cellulose)
vision_details.description: Fiber processing processes optimized for high-purity alpha-cellulose production. Alpha-cellulose is a critical raw material for paper, chemical industry, and special applications. RNG Export's technology provides fiber ready for industrial cellulose production with high purity ratios and consistent quality.

vision_details.title: Nitrocellulose and defence applications
vision_details.description: High-quality fiber processing suitable for nitrocellulose production for defense industry and special applications. Nitrocellulose is a critical raw material used in propellants, explosives, and special chemical applications. Through RNG Export's rigorous quality control processes, fiber production compliant with defense industry standards is carried out.

vision_details.title: Biocomposite and bioplastic
vision_details.description: Fiber processing technologies optimized for sustainable biocomposite and bioplastic production. Biocomposites produced from natural fibers offer sustainable alternatives to synthetic materials in automotive, furniture, packaging, and construction sectors. RNG Export's fiber processing technology provides ideal raw materials for high-performance biocomposite production.

vision_details.title: Nonwoven & textile industries
vision_details.description: Fiber processing solutions specially developed for nonwoven and textile industries. Products produced in cottonized fiber, short fiber, and long fiber formats are used in hygiene, medical, filtration, cleaning, and technical textile applications. RNG Export's technology provides raw materials ready for textile production lines with high quality and homogeneous structure.

lines.section_title: Three fully integrated solutions we offer to the global market.

items.title: KENEVA – Flax & Hemp Pre-Processing Line
items.desc: The line where raw bales from the field are opened for the first time, woody parts are separated from the main fiber, impurities are removed and a stable infeed flow is created.
outputs: Opening bales without breaking their integrity
Separating shives, dust, straw and foreign material
items.benefit: Increases the efficiency of subsequent stages by 40–55%. An essential prerequisite for cellulose, biocomposite and cottonization applications.

items.title: KOTONEX – Flax & Hemp Cottonization Line
items.desc: This is the heart of the process. The cottonization line shortens the fiber length, refines and cleans the fibers, reduces weight and brings them into a cotton-like form.
outputs: Material free from metals and dust

items.title: Long Fiber Processing Line
items.desc: This line produces long fibers specifically for technical textiles, automotive composites and construction reinforcement materials.
features: Special openers preventing fiber length degradation

process.section_desc: A proven process scheme applied across all our lines for maximum efficiency.

step_details.title: Raw Bale Feeding
step_details.description: The stage where raw bales are fed into the processing line automatically or manually. Ensures regular and controlled entry of bales into the system.

step_details.title: KENEVA Pre-Opening
step_details.description: The process of opening bales and initial fiber separation. This stage is critical for increasing the efficiency of subsequent processes.

step_details.title: RODI Screening (1st Stage)
step_details.description: First stage screening process with rotary drum screen system. Dust, shives and short particles are separated.

step_details.title: Shaker Fine Cleaning
step_details.description: Fine cleaning stage with vibrating screen system. Small particles and dust are completely separated.

step_details.title: Shive / Dust Extraction
step_details.description: Removal of shives and dust particles from fibers through aspiration system. Product quality is determined at this stage.

step_details.title: Metal Detection
step_details.description: Detection and removal of metal particles in fibers through metal detector system. Critical stage for machine safety.

step_details.title: Cottonization Unit
step_details.description: Critical stage where fibers are converted to cotton-like form. Fibers are refined and standardized through multi-stage carding system.

step_details.title: Long Fiber Unit
step_details.description: Special unit where 6-40 cm long fibers are processed while preserving their length. Optimized for technical textile and composite applications.

step_details.title: Final Stabilization
step_details.description: Final quality control and stabilization stage of processed fibers. Product standardization is achieved.

step_details.title: Bale Pressing
step_details.description: Baling of processed fibers with automatic pressing system. High-density, transport-ready bales are created.

outputs.title: COTTONIZED FIBER
outputs.desc: Industrial-grade fiber in a cotton-like form.

outputs.title: CLEANED LONG FIBER
outputs.desc: Long fibers optimized for technical textile and composite applications.

outputs.title: SHORT FIBER
outputs.desc: Standardized short fibers for nonwovens and biocomposites.

output_details.title: COTTONIZED FIBER
output_details.description: Premium industrial-grade processed fiber transformed from flax and hemp fibers into cotton-like form through RNG Export's advanced multi-stage carding system. This product undergoes a sophisticated refinement and standardization process, acquiring cotton-like structure and feel. With high purity ratios and homogeneous fiber distribution, it is ready for critical industrial applications such as nonwoven, yarn, biocomposite, and cellulose production. Manufactured using RNG Export's advanced cottonization technology, this fiber offers a sustainable and eco-friendly alternative, playing a pioneering role in textile and composite sectors.
features: Homogeneous fiber distribution and standardized size
Optimized for nonwoven and yarn production
Suitable for biocomposite and cellulose applications
Low moisture content and stable structure
Completely free from metal and dust

output_details.title: CLEANED LONG FIBER
output_details.description: Premium product specially optimized for technical textile and composite applications, processed while preserving the integrity of 6-40 cm long fibers. Thanks to RNG Export's advanced long fiber processing technology, natural fiber strength and durability are preserved while completely removing metal particles and dust. This product offers a sustainable alternative to glass fiber and synthetic fibers, used in the production of high-performance composite materials in automotive, aerospace, construction, and maritime sectors. With homogeneous quality and consistent fiber length distribution, it provides a reliable raw material that meets industrial standards.
features: Completely free from metal and dust
Homogeneous quality and consistent fiber distribution
Low moisture content and stable structure

output_details.title: SHORT FIBER
output_details.description: Specially standardized, high-quality processed short fiber for nonwoven and biocomposite sectors. Through RNG Export's rigorous quality control processes, it is produced in industrial-ready format with homogeneous size distribution and consistent quality. This product has a wide range of applications including filling materials, insulation products, and packaging industry. With high absorbent properties and eco-friendly structure, it is a preferred raw material in sustainable production processes. Thanks to standardized size and homogeneous distribution, it can be processed smoothly in production lines and provides consistent results.
applications: Garden and agricultural applications (mulch, soil improvement)

machinesSection.section_desc: Nine core units engineered specifically for flax and hemp processing.

items.name: KENEVA – Fiber Pre-Processing Unit
items.description: The first major unit receiving input from raw bales. It opens the bale without destroying integrity, reduces large fractions, and separates fiber from the core to ensure stable intake flow.
features: Automatic control system stabilizing feed density

detailSpecs.Function: Bale opening, fiber shredding, coarse carding

items.name: Fiber Cottonization Machine
items.description: Performs the final and most critical transformation of the fiber. It refines fibers, stabilizes length, and brings them into a 'cotton-like' form. Produces the 'gold standard' raw material for cellulose, NC, biocomposite, yarn, and nonwoven production.

items.name: Long Fiber Processing Unit
items.description: Processes flax/hemp long fibers (6–40 cm) while preserving their structure. Operates with special openers preventing fiber breakage and low-speed controlled carding drums.

items.name: RODI – Rotary Drum Screen
items.description: Critical screening technology used at every stage of flax and hemp processes. Separates dust, shives, and short particles from the fiber, determining product quality.

items.name: Vertical Bale Press
items.description: Compact packaging solution for short fiber, cottonized fiber, and long fiber. Creates high-density bales with automatic compression.

items.name: Horizontal Bale Press
items.description: High-volume press system preferred by large-capacity facilities, suitable for continuous feeding.
features: Automatic wire tying or steel strap option

items.name: Aspiration Unit
items.description: The brain of the entire line; collects dust, light particles, and fiber fly. Maintains facility air quality and ensures ATEX safety. Multi-stage aspiration system captures dust and particles at each processing point. Cyclone and bag filter combination effectively separates both heavy and fine particles. Frequency inverter-controlled fans automatically adjust flow rate according to line load, optimizing energy consumption and preventing filter overload.

items.name: Magnetic Detector
items.description: Protects the entire line and machines by separating metal parts coming from raw material. Critical for the safety of RODI and cottonization units. Multi-stage magnetic and sensor-based detection system detects iron, stainless steel, and other metal particles within milliseconds. When metal is detected, the line automatically stops and the operator is alerted. This protects blades, drums, and other sensitive equipment, guarantees product quality, and minimizes ATEX safety risks.
features: Continuous monitoring with metal density sensor

items.name: Shaker Unit
items.description: Fine cleaning and separation machine that determines the final form of the fiber, separating remaining shives and sawdust. With multi-stage vibrating screen system, it ensures separation of even the smallest particles in the fiber. Thanks to anti-blinding technology, screens remain continuously open and cleaning efficiency does not drop. Integrated operation with aspiration system guarantees complete removal of dust and light particles.

items.name: Pellet Machine
items.description: Converts production waste or by-products into pellet form.

items.name: Seed Screening Unit
items.description: Used for separating and cleaning seeds after harvest. Multi-stage screening system ensures precise separation of seeds of different sizes. Automatic removal of dust, foreign matter, and damaged seeds guarantees high-quality seed production. Adjustable screen openings allow optimization for flax, hemp, and other oilseeds. Integrated aspiration system captures dust and light particles at source, ensuring clean and quality seed production.

blog.label: BLOG
blog.heading: Engineering Insights on Hemp & Flax Fiber
blog.subheading: Field-proven tips on cottonization, long fiber stability, turnkey plants and quality optimization.

hemp-line-optimization.title: Optimizing Hemp Lines: The Golden Rules of Cottonization
hemp-line-optimization.excerpt: Removing moisture, dust and metal before cottonization boosts throughput up to 30%. Which sensors and drum speeds matter most?
hemp-line-optimization.content: Three critical parameters define cottonization yield: inlet moisture (8–12%), drum speed and aspiration flow. Sensor-based density control keeps the line stable and trims energy use.
hemp-line-optimization.long_content:
In industrial hemp processing facilities, the most critical way to increase efficiency is to standardize the quality of the material entering the cottonization line. Our field experience at RNG Export shows that capacity increases of up to 30% are achieved not just by increasing machine speed, but by optimizing the process.

Rule One: Inlet Moisture. The moisture content of the fiber entering the cottonization unit must be between 8% and 12%. Fiber that is too dry breaks and turns into dust; fiber that is too moist wraps around drums and causes blockages. We use sensors that continuously measure moisture at the line inlet and automatic humidification units to maintain this balance.

Rule Two: Drum Speed and Blade Geometry. Every hemp variety is different. Drum revolutions per minute (RPM) must be dynamically adjustable via PLC according to fiber strength. On RNG Export lines, operators can optimize machine settings in seconds by running recipe-based production during raw material changes.

Rule Three: Aspiration Flow. Removing micro-dust and short fibers released during cottonization is vital for both product quality and ATEX safety. Insufficient suction causes fibers to re-agglomerate (nep formation). RNG Export aspiration units save energy and offer maximum cleaning by adjusting flow rates as needed thanks to frequency inverter fans.

flax-turnkey-factory.title: Turnkey Flax Fiber Plant: A Practical Guide
flax-turnkey-factory.excerpt: Flax stalk breaking, shive control and long fiber protection: ATEX safety, aspiration layout, and post-baling logistics.
flax-turnkey-factory.content: Biggest loss in flax lines is fiber breakage and shive density fluctuation. Low-torque openers, fine shaker screening and automatic bale pressing deliver homogeneous density.
flax-turnkey-factory.long_content:
Setting up a flax processing plant requires integrated process engineering, not just lining up machines. Every step from the arrival of bales from the field to the shipment of processed fiber must be planned.

1. Decortication (Stalk Breaking and Pre-Opening): Separating the woody part (shive) of the flax stalk from the fiber begins with a mechanical breaking process. The critical part here is to break the woody part without shortening the fiber length. RNG Export's KENEVA series openers ensure maximum shive separation without damaging the fiber thanks to special blade angles.

2. Fine Cleaning (Scutching & Shaking): Multi-deck shaker systems are used to clean remaining small woody particles. Thanks to our anti-blinding technology, screens remain continuously open and cleaning efficiency does not drop.

3. ATEX and Safety: Flax dust is highly flammable. The facility's aspiration system and electrical panels must comply with ATEX standards. RNG Export offers spark detection and automatic suppression systems as standard.

4. Logistics and Baling: Processed flax fiber is voluminous. High-density bale presses are used to reduce transport costs. Our fully automatic presses speed up your logistics operation by working with a capacity of up to 5 tons per hour.

long-fiber-composites.title: Long Fiber for Composites: Automotive-Grade Flax & Hemp
long-fiber-composites.excerpt: Preserving 6–40 cm fibers is critical for lightweight alternatives to glass fiber. How stabilization and metal detection affect surface quality.
long-fiber-composites.content: With low-speed controlled drums and anti-blinding shakers, fiber integrity is preserved, tensile strength rises, and biocomposites gain better surface quality.
long-fiber-composites.long_content:
The automotive industry is turning to natural fibers instead of glass fiber to reduce vehicle weight and carbon footprint. Flax and hemp are the strongest candidates with their high strength-to-weight ratio. However, the fiber to be used in composite production must meet certain standards.

Fiber Length: The main factor providing strength in composite materials is fiber length. RNG Export's long fiber lines process fibers between 6-40 cm while preserving them. By avoiding aggressive openers, the natural structure of the fiber is not disrupted.

Metal and Foreign Matter: A metal particle in injection or pressing molds can lead to disaster. Therefore, our lines feature multi-stage magnetic detectors and metal separators. We guarantee 100% metal-free fiber.

Homogeneity: In composite part production, the fiber must be distributed evenly within the mold. Our KOTONEX technology prevents clumping by individualizing fibers and facilitates resin impregnation.

Door panels, dashboard bodies, and interior trim parts produced with this technology possess both lightweight and impact-absorbing properties.

hemp-dust-control.title: Dust & ATEX Control in Hemp Lines: Aspiration Tips
hemp-dust-control.excerpt: Cut dust, sparks, and fiber loss with multi-stage aspiration and sensor-based airflow. Which filter, which fan?
hemp-dust-control.content: Fine dust and metal particles reduce both quality and safety. The right cyclone, bag filter, and VFD fan combo is critical.
hemp-dust-control.long_content:
Dust management in hemp processing is as much about safety (ATEX) as it is about product quality. Key principles we use at RNG Export:

1) Multi-Stage Aspiration: Separate aspiration after bale opening, decortication, and cottonization. Dust and short fibers are captured at the source, not returned to the line.

2) Sensor-Based Flow Control: VFD-driven fans adjust airflow to line load. This lowers energy use and prevents filter overload.

3) Cyclone + Bag Filter: Cyclone captures heavy particles; bag filter traps fine dust. ATEX safety valves and spark detection modules minimize fire risk.

4) Metal Separation: Magnetic detectors and separators reduce metal risk in dust, protecting knives and ensuring product safety.

flax-quality-control.title: Flax Fiber Quality Control: Moisture, Shive, and Metal
flax-quality-control.excerpt: Operator recipes, online moisture sensors, and metal separation keep flax lines consistent. Which metric at which step?
flax-quality-control.content: Three metrics define flax quality: moisture, shive ratio, and metal contamination. Inline sensors and recipe-based runs are key.
flax-quality-control.long_content:
In flax fiber production, fluctuating quality raises rejection risk. RNG Export lines monitor key metrics:

1) Moisture Management: Online sensors keep 8–12% band. Over-dry fiber creates dust; over-wet fiber wraps drums. Humidification/drying adjusts per recipe.

2) Shive Control: After shaker + aspiration, shive ratio is measured inline. If out of band, line speed and airflow self-optimize.

3) Metal & Foreign Matter: Multi-stage magnets and metal separators improve machine life and product safety—protecting card wires and blades.

4) Recipe-Based Production: Operators pick predefined recipes per raw material source. Keeps quality stable and shortens changeover.

hemp-metal-detection.title: Metal Separation in Hemp Lines: Blade Life & Safety
hemp-metal-detection.excerpt: Use multi-stage magnets and separators after decortication to extend blade life and cut spark risk.
hemp-metal-detection.content: Metal contamination drives knife wear and spark risk. Multi-stage magnetic separation with sensor alerts is critical.
hemp-metal-detection.long_content:
Metal particles in hemp/flax lines shorten knife life, reduce product quality, and raise ATEX risk. Our approach:

1) Multi-Stage Magnets: At bale opener and decorticator outlets; second stage before card wires and drums.

2) Metal Separator: Inline in aspiration; sensor-driven ejection removes metal from flow.

3) Sensor & Alarm: When metal density crosses threshold, line speed is reduced and operators are alerted to check knives.

4) Spark Risk: Metal + dust increases spark risk; ATEX valves and spark detection modules are integrated.

flax-energy-optimization.title: Energy Optimization in Flax Lines: Fans, Drying, Automation
flax-energy-optimization.excerpt: Cut energy up to 18% with VFD fans, moisture-driven drying, and recipe-based speed control.
flax-energy-optimization.content: Energy load concentrates in drying, aspiration, and drive motors. VFDs and sensors make the difference.
flax-energy-optimization.long_content:
Energy cost is a major share in flax/hemp operations. Key optimizations we deploy:

1) Aspiration Fans: VFD fans adjust flow to line load; filter differential pressure drives automatic modes.

2) Drying: Moisture sensors prevent over-drying below target band; quality is preserved while energy drops.

3) Automation / Recipes: Pre-set profiles for speed, temperature, and airflow per material; faster changeover.

4) Energy Monitoring: Line-level kWh tracking and reporting for peak demand management and maintenance planning.

q1.question: Who are hemp machine manufacturers?
q1.answer: RNG Export is an engineering company that manufactures cottonization, decorticator, peeling and fiber opening machines for hemp and flax fiber processing.

q2.question: What products are obtained with flax processing machines?
q2.answer: Long fiber, short fiber, cottonized fiber and biocomposite raw materials are produced from flax and hemp.

q3.question: What lines are found in a turnkey fiber plant?
q3.answer: It includes bale opening, decorticator, aspiration, cottonization, long fiber line, drying, pressing and automation integration.

q4.question: What is the difference between flax and hemp processing machines?
q4.answer: Flax fibers are finer and more delicate, requiring lower speeds and gentler openers. Hemp is tougher and needs higher crushing power in the decorticator. RNG Export lines offer the flexibility to process both products on a single line thanks to inverter-controlled motors and interchangeable knife sets.

q5.question: What is the cost of a turnkey fiber plant installation?
q5.answer: The cost varies depending on capacity (tons/hour), automation level, and selected machine configuration. We offer scalable solutions ranging from 1 ton/hour starter lines to 5 ton/hour fully automated integrated facilities. You can contact our engineers for detailed feasibility and price offers.

q6.question: How is decorticator machine efficiency measured?
q6.answer: Decorticator efficiency is measured by the ratio of woody parts (shives) separated without fiber loss. A good decorticator should provide 80-90% cleaning without breaking the fiber. RNG Export decorticators offer minimum fiber loss and maximum cleaning with adjustable knife angles and an optimized feeding system.
